summary: This is an email from a prosecutor (SP) regarding a 'friendly subpoena' to be sent to an attorney (MI) to obtain a copy of the settlement agreement between a victim (Jane Doe) and Jeffrey Epstein, which resolved a 2009 civil suit. The document is part of the ongoing investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell's participation in the abuse.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the ongoing investigation into her participation in the abuse of a victim, which the requested settlement agreement is relevant to.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in the 2009 civil suit brought by a victim, which was resolved by the settlement agreement being sought.

connections.description: MI possesses a copy of the settlement agreement that resolved a civil suit between a victim and Jeffrey Epstein.
Maxwell is under investigation for her participation in the abuse of a victim, which is connected to Epstein's case.
Prosecutor SP is coordinating with attorney MI to obtain a settlement agreement via a 'friendly subpoena' for an ongoing investigation.

events.title: Civil suit against Epstein
events.description: A civil lawsuit was filed against Jeffrey Epstein by a victim, which was later resolved by a settlement agreement.

events.title: Request for friendly subpoena
events.description: Prosecutor SP emails about sending a 'friendly subpoena' to attorney MI to obtain the settlement agreement from the 2009 Epstein civil case.

keyFacts: A settlement agreement exists that resolved a 2009 civil suit against Jeffrey Epstein brought by a victim.
Attorney MI possesses a copy of this settlement agreement but believes he needs a subpoena to provide it to investigators.
The Maxwell investigation team is seeking this agreement as it is relevant to investigating Ghislaine Maxwell's participation in the abuse.
The email refers to prior interviews conducted in Florida where MI disclosed the existence of the agreement.
This document shows ongoing investigative efforts in 2021 to gather evidence related to the Epstein-Maxwell case.
